DOC.HEAD: Danish Queen Returns Romanian Orders
With AM-Romania, Bjt
DOC.TEXT: Queen Margrethe II of Denmark has decided to return orders she received from toppled Romanian President Nicolae Ceausescu, press reports said Sunday. Queen Margrethe and the Prince Consort Henrik were decorated with Romanian orders during Ceausescu's official visit to Denmark in November 1980, the daily Jyllands-Posten said. The queen also canceled the Order of the Knight of the Great Cross, which she gave to Ceausescu's wife, Elena. The former president was erased as Knight of the Elephant Order, Denmark's most prestigious and highest ranking order, which is awarded only to members of royal families and heads of state. Ceausescu was overthrown Friday in a popular revolt against his hard-line Communist rule.
